page.title: 03Longlands Farm;Nether Silton
page.content: Apart from grass, wheat and barley are the main crops grown.The barley is sold for malting and for export to Germany and the Middle East whilst the wheat is used for flour.A limited amount of oil seed rape is grown too.In future we may grow peas and linseed. 3 men work the farm,one man can milk 60 cows per hour.At busy times such as harvest and silaging we may bring in extra labour. Today farming is more of a business than a way of life.Large amounts of money have been invested in milking parlours,grain dryers etc. and more artificial fertiliser is applied producing more grass on fewer acres.Artificial insemination has been a great step forward in animal breeding,we can use top class stock on our animals.
